nodes.bodyText: Do we need to copy these? Just wrapping in a unmodifiable map should be enough. After the span ends :) before it is needed.
good call. I'll make that change and re-benchmark

Actually, are you suggesting we do this inside the RERS when the span ends? If we did that, we'd need to have an extra field to hold it, unless we created a version of the AttributesMap that was immutable.
It isn't right now, if we let it escape the RERS. Are you saying we should make it so?

Not sure I understand the concern. We call the wrapper using Collections.unmodifiableMap(attributeMap). So nobody can change the attributeMap via SpanData, and nobody can change attributeMap via RERS because hasEnded is true so no changes will happen.
Right, if we do the wrapping here, then everything is fine. I thought maybe you were considering doing the wrapping earlier, immediately on the span ending, rather than on the call to toSpanData.
Also, I think we should wrap the links and events, as well.
We can do both later. Let's merge it as it is for the moment. I think this is a good start.
